name: Wizard Spider (G0102)
description: Enterprise techniques used by Wizard Spider, ATT&CK group G0102 v1.1

techniques.comment: [Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used HTTP for network communications.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)
[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used macros to execute PowerShell scripts to download malware on victims machines.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has installed [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266) as a service named ControlServiceA in order to establish persistence.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has installed [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266) as a service named ControlServiceA in order to establish persistence.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has collected and staged credentials and network enumeration information, using  the networkdll and psfin [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266) modules.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used AdFind.exe to collect information about Active Directory organizational units and trust objects.(Citation: FireEye Ryuk and Trickbot January 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has exfiltrated domain credentials and network enumeration information over command and control (C2) channels.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)
[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used file deletion to remove some modules and configurations from an infected host after use.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)
[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used stolen credentials to copy tools into the %TEMP% directory of domain controllers.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used scheduled tasks to install [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266), using task names to appear legitimate such as WinDotNet, GoogleTask, or Sysnetsf.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has modified the Registry key HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest by setting the UseLogonCredential registry value to 1 in order to force credentials to be stored in clear text in memory.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) used base64 encoding to obfuscate an [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) service.(Citation: FireEye Ryuk and Trickbot January 2019)
[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used AdFind.exe to collect information about Active Directory groups and accounts.(Citation: FireEye Ryuk and Trickbot January 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used spearphishing attachments to deliver Microsoft documents containing macros to download either [Emotet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0367), Bokbot, or [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266).(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)
[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used RDP for lateral movement.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used networkdll for network discovery and psfin specifically for financial and point of sale indicators. [Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has also used AdFind.exe to enumerate domain computers, including the domain controller.(Citation: FireEye Ryuk and Trickbot January 2019)(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used scheduled tasks establish persistence for [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266).(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used scheduled tasks establish persistence for [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266).(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used scheduled tasks establish persistence for [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266).(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has lured victims to execute malware with spearphishing attachments containing macros to download either [Emotet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0367), Bokbot, or [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266).(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)
[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used valid credentials for privileged accounts with the goal of accessing domain controllers.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)
[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used valid credentials for privileged accounts with the goal of accessing domain controllers.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)
[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used valid credentials for privileged accounts with the goal of accessing domain controllers.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)
[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used valid credentials for privileged accounts with the goal of accessing domain controllers.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)
[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has used WMI and LDAP queries for network discovery.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)

WIZARD SPIDER has gained access to credentials via exported copies of the ntds.dit  Active Directory database.

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has sent phishing emails containing a link to an actor-controlled Google Drive document or other free online file hosting  services.

https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/alerts/aa20-302a

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/11/05/ryuk-speed-run-2-hours-to-ransom/

WIZARD SPIDER has injected malicious DLLs into memory with read, write, and execute permissions.

https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/alerts/aa20-302a

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/11/05/ryuk-speed-run-2-hours-to-ransom/

WIZARD SPIDER has injected malicious DLLs into memory with read, write, and execute permissions.

https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/alerts/aa20-302a

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/11/05/ryuk-speed-run-2-hours-to-ransom/

WIZARD SPIDER has lured victims into clicking a malicious link delivered through spearphishing.

https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/alerts/aa20-302a

WIZARD SPIDER has established persistence via the Registry key HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run and a shortcut within the startup folder

https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/alerts/aa20-302a

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has established persistence via the Registry key HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run and a shortcut within the startup folder

https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/alerts/aa20-302a

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has established persistence using Userinit by adding the Registry key HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon. 

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has established persistence using Userinit by adding the Registry key HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon. 

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has used cmd.exe to execute commands on a victim’s machine. 

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/08/ryuks-return/

WIZARD SPIDER has exfiltrated victim information using FTP.  

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/08/ryuks-return/ 
  https://thedfirreport.com/2020/11/05/ryuk-speed-run-2-hours-to-ransom/

WIZARD SPIDER has exploited or attempted to exploit Zerologon (CVE-2020-1472) and EternalBlue (MS17-010) vulnerabilities.

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html 
  https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/08/ryuks-return/ 
  https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/18/ryuk-in-5-hours/

WIZARD SPIDER has accessed victim networks by using stolen credentials to access the corporate VPN infrastructure.  

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has accessed victim networks by using stolen credentials to access the corporate VPN infrastructure.  

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has used the icacls command to modify access control to backup servers, providing them with full control of all the system folders. 

https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2020/10/14/inside-a-new-ryuk-ransomware-attack/

WIZARD SPIDER has shut down or uninstalled security applications on victim systems that might prevent ransomware from executing.   

https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/alerts/aa20-302a
  https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/08/ryuks-return/
  www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has used the Invoke-Inveigh  PowerShell cmdlets, likely for name service poisoning.  

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has used the Invoke-Inveigh  PowerShell cmdlets, likely for name service poisoning.  

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has used the “net view”   command to locate mapped network shares. 

https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/alerts/aa20-302a

WIZARD SPIDER has acquired credentials from the SAM/SECURITY registry hives. 

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER obtained a code signing certificate signed by Digicert for BazarLoader.

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/11/05/ryuk-speed-run-2-hours-to-ransom/

WIZARD SPIDER has used SMB to drop Cobalt Strike Beacon on a domain controller for lateral movement.  

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/08/ryuks-return/
  https://thedfirreport.com/2020/11/05/ryuk-speed-run-2-hours-to-ransom/

WIZARD SPIDER has used Window Remote Management to move laterally through a victim network.

https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/alerts/aa20-302a

WIZARD SPIDER has used taskkill.exe,  and net.exe to stop backup, catalog, cloud, and other services prior to network encryption.  

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/08/ryuks-return/

WIZARD SPIDER has use WMI to identify anti-virus products installed on a victim’s machine. 

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/08/ryuks-return/

WIZARD SPIDER has used Rubeus, MimiKatz Kerberos module, and the Invoke-Kerberoast cmdlet to steal AES hashes.

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/08/ryuks-return/
  www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html 
  https://thedfirreport.com/2020/11/05/ryuk-speed-run-2-hours-to-ransom/ 
  https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has used Digicert code-signing certificates for some of its malware. 

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/11/05/ryuk-speed-run-2-hours-to-ransom/

WIZARD SPIDER has used “systeminfo” and similar commands to acquire detailed configuration information of a victim machine. 

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/08/ryuks-return/

WIZARD SPIDER has used the ipconfig command to identify the network configuration of a victim machine.

https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2020/10/14/inside-a-new-ryuk-ransomware-attack/

WIZARD SPIDER has used whoami to identify the local user and their privileges.  

https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2020/10/14/inside-a-new-ryuk-ransomware-attack/

WIZARD SPIDER has used services.exe to execute scripts and executables during lateral movement within a victim network.  

https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/08/ryuks-return/
  https://thedfirreport.com/2020/10/18/ryuk-in-5-hours/

WIZARD SPIDER has used administrative accounts, including Domain Admin,  to move laterally within a victim network. 

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has used administrative accounts, including Domain Admin,  to move laterally within a victim network. 

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has used administrative accounts, including Domain Admin,  to move laterally within a victim network. 

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html

WIZARD SPIDER has used administrative accounts, including Domain Admin,  to move laterally within a victim network. 

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html
